content.body: Hello. I guess this is the new USENET/IRC.

I recently discovered that there is no default value for the @scope attribute of the TH element. I always thought it was `row` for children of TBODY and `col` otherwise. Is that not how browsers behave anyway?
content.formatted_body: I recently discovered that there is no default value for the @scope attribute of the TH element. I always thought it was row for children of TBODY and col otherwise. Is that not how browsers behave anyway?

content.body: If confirmed, would it be wise to codify that behaviour in the standard? (and, is Ian Hickson still the editor?)
content.formatted_body: If confirmed, would it be wise to codify that behaviour in the standard? (and, is Ian Hickson still the editor?)
